newsitem.title: HUNGARY: ITALY TO INVEST $ BILLIONS IN EASTERN EUROPE - RADIO.
newsitem.headline: ITALY TO INVEST $ BILLIONS IN EASTERN EUROPE - RADIO.

text.p: Italian investors plan to invest billions of dollars in eastern Europe in cooperation with Hungarian companies, Gabor Szeles, president of the Hungarian Industrialists Alliance (GYOSZ) said on Friday.
"It is true that we got an opportunity for investments of $1 billion annually in eastern Europe," Szeles told the Hungarian Radio following his talks with the investors in Italy.
Szeles said the funds would finance projects, but he did not disclose who the Italian investors were nor that how many years were covered by the agreement.
Szeles said the investments were likely to be carried out in cooperation with GYOSZ.
"This indicates that western investors' confidence in Hungary is very strong," he added.
Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi, visiting Hungary earlier this week, said that trade links between Hungary and Italy had grown substantially and urged more Italian companies to enter the market.
